title: Build a Swamp Bed Shelter
brief: Construct an elevated sleeping platform to stay dry in marshes, swamps, or areas with standing water.
steps: Step 1: Find four trees in rectangular formation or cut four poles (bamboo ideal) and drive firmly into ground.
Step 2: Ensure poles are far enough apart and strong enough to support your height, weight, and equipment.
Step 3: Cut two poles that span the rectangle width, strong enough to support your weight.
Step 4: Secure these poles to the trees/uprights high enough above ground to account for tides and high water.
Step 5: Cut additional poles spanning the rectangle length and lay across the two side poles.
Step 6: Secure the length-spanning poles in place.
Step 7: Cover the bed frame top with broad leaves or grass for comfortable sleeping surface.
Step 8: Build a fire pad by laying clay, silt, or mud on one corner and allow to dry.
warnings: Platform must be high enough above water to account for tides and water level changes.
Ensure all poles are strong enough to support your full weight plus equipment.
Consider weather conditions, wind, and tides when selecting the site.
